short_summary: The proposal must set out the means by which the technical, performance, time and other goals and objectives will be met, with regard to all stated requirements.
description: Les Services de TI, Services ministriels d'Infrastructure Canada  ont besoin de specialistes du service de dépannage pour travailler avec le personnel d'INFC afin d' aider au déploiement d'ordinateurs et d'appareils cellulaires; de répondre aux demandes d'assistance des clients en matière de technologies de l'information (TI); de déployer des mises à niveau du matériel et des logiciels; et de s'occuper d'autres activités connexes au sein du Ministère.
full_summary:
As part of our IT department's ongoing efforts, Infrastructure Canada (INFC) invites the public to a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Help Desk Specialist services.

**Key Information:**

* ** Tender Reference Number:** cb-935-22644935
* ** Tender ID:** INFC-2023-24-PS4570
* ** Tender Closing Date:** 30 October 2023, at 14:00 hours
* ** Anticipated Contract Start Date:** 14 November 2023

**Background**

Infrastructure Canada (INFC) requires the services of Help Desk Specialists for various activities, including deploying computers, cellular devices, responding to clients' Information Technology (IT) assistance requests, and conducting hardware and software upgrades. 

**Contract Details:**

The proposed contract will be awarded to the supplier offering the most suitable proposal, as determined by the evaluation factors outlined in the RFP.

**Evaluation Criteria**

Help Desk Specialists will be selected based on the Combined Rating of Technical Merit (40%) and Price (60%).

**Preferred Contractors**

Contractors holding agreements under the following trade agreements are eligible to participate: Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Japan-Canada Economic Partnership Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canadian Free Trade Agreement, and the Agreement on Government Procurement of the World Trade Organization.

**Deadlines and Contacts**

The RFP must be submitted by 30 October 2023, at 14:00 hours. Requests for clarification should be directed to the named contact:

Alexander Caro, Procurement Officer 
Phone: 343-576-3527 
Email: procurement-approvisionnement@infc.gc.ca'):
## **Additional Attachments**

Access the RFP and supporting documents through: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca>.
